pullRequest.body:
---

This PR gives isomorphisms between `groupCohomology A n` (defined as the `n`th cohomology of the complex of inhomogeneous cochains of `A`, whose `n`th object is `(Fin n â†’ G) â†’ A`) and `Hn A` (defined more minimally and explicitly) for `n = 0, 1, 2`. We do the same for cocycles. 

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [ ] depends on: #8845 
[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: I think that the API of homological complexes has to be developed a little bit more in order to ease the constructions here. I have started experimenting on another branch https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/HnIsoGroupCohomology_jriou ; see commit https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/e76c697f92964c85244bb14f98c48efaf91fd4b7 ) I will try to see if this API addition is exactly what we need to improve this computation (and future ones!), and I will PR the missing API as soon as possible...

In my branch `HnIsoGroupCohomology_jriou` (see diff https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/HnIsoGroupCohomology...HnIsoGroupCohomology_jriou ) I have added the suitable homology API. In order to use the API, the design suggestion I make is that the comparison iso between the complexes, e.g. `shortComplexH1Iso` should be `(inhomogeneousCochains A).sc' 0 1 2 â‰… shortComplexH1 A` (with nice definitional properties) rather than `(inhomogeneousCochains A).sc 1 â‰… shortComplexH1 A` (which involves the `ComplexShape.prev/next` which is more opaque). Then, with the appropriate general API which relates the homology/cycles/opcycles with that of `HomologicalComplex.sc' 0 1 2`, most of proofs can be done by simp.

Similarly, for zero cocycles, I am not sure we need to introduce an extra definition of `zeroCocycles` because this identifies to `H0` (i.e. invariants). Then, in order to have a quite similar design as above, as there is only a kernel in degree `0`, I suggest that the iso of short complexes which was necessary in degrees `> 0` be replaced by just an `Arrow` isomorphism. The equational lemmas are easily obtained.

(Before this experiment with group cohomology, I was not completely sure about the exact API that might be needed in order to handle this smoothly. I think that this is the right design.)

I will PR the necessary general homological complex API in a separate PR, so that this one can depend on it.
Thank you so much! I've merged `HnIsoGroupCohomology_jriou` into mine, I hope that's wise? I'm still not confident with git.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#8845~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!

I will go through the definitions and proofs again in more details soon. I may have some suggestions in order to improve the code for the isomorphisms and compatibilites.

```suggestion
def cocycles (n : â„•) : ModuleCat k := (inhomogeneousCochains A).cycles n
```
I would rather declare this as an abbreviation, and similarly for the definitions below of the form `(inhomogeneousCochains A).something`. This may help for testing/improving automation for the proofs.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RepresentationTheory/GroupCohomology/LowDegree): Identify `groupCohomology A n`with `Hn A` for `n = 0, 1, 2`

nodes.body: I will go through the definitions and proofs again in more details soon. I may have some suggestions in order to improve the code for the isomorphisms and compatibilites.

I think that the API of homological complexes has to be developed a little bit more in order to ease the constructions here. I have started experimenting on another branch https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/HnIsoGroupCohomology_jriou ; see commit https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/e76c697f92964c85244bb14f98c48efaf91fd4b7 ) I will try to see if this API addition is exactly what we need to improve this computation (and future ones!), and I will PR the missing API as soon as possible...

In my branch `HnIsoGroupCohomology_jriou` (see diff https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/HnIsoGroupCohomology...HnIsoGroupCohomology_jriou ) I have added the suitable homology API. In order to use the API, the design suggestion I make is that the comparison iso between the complexes, e.g. `shortComplexH1Iso` should be `(inhomogeneousCochains A).sc' 0 1 2 â‰… shortComplexH1 A` (with nice definitional properties) rather than `(inhomogeneousCochains A).sc 1 â‰… shortComplexH1 A` (which involves the `ComplexShape.prev/next` which is more opaque). Then, with the appropriate general API which relates the homology/cycles/opcycles with that of `HomologicalComplex.sc' 0 1 2`, most of proofs can be done by simp.

Similarly, for zero cocycles, I am not sure we need to introduce an extra definition of `zeroCocycles` because this identifies to `H0` (i.e. invariants). Then, in order to have a quite similar design as above, as there is only a kernel in degree `0`, I suggest that the iso of short complexes which was necessary in degrees `> 0` be replaced by just an `Arrow` isomorphism. The equational lemmas are easily obtained.

(Before this experiment with group cohomology, I was not completely sure about the exact API that might be needed in order to handle this smoothly. I think that this is the right design.)

I will PR the necessary general homological complex API in a separate PR, so that this one can depend on it.
